item.title: 路透社称，OpenAI 计划终止非营利组织董事会的控制权
item.description: 据路透社援引知情人士的话报道，ChatGPT 背后的人工智能初创公司 OpenAI 正在制定一项重组计划，以便其非营利董事会不再控制公司的主要业务。【原文：OpenAI, the artificial intelligence startup behind ChatGPT, is working on a plan to restructure so that its nonprofit board would no longer control its main business, Reuters reported, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 鲍威尔领导美联储大幅降息后更显强势
item.description: 在美联储官员本月齐聚华盛顿的前一周，他们在降息的速度上出现了分歧。【原文：One week before Federal Reserve officials gathered in Washington this month, they were split over how fast to lower interest rates.】

item.title: 人工智能计算需求提升，美光业绩飙升
item.description: 美国最大的计算机内存芯片制造商美光科技公司（Micron Technology Inc.【原文：Micron Technology Inc., the largest US maker of computer memory chips, surged in late trading after giving surprisingly strong sales and profit forecasts, helped by demand for artificial intelligence gear.】

item.title: 美联储主席库格勒表示 "强烈支持 "降息半点
item.description: 美联储理事阿德里安娜-库格勒（Adriana Kugler）表示，她 "强烈支持 "央行上周将借贷成本降低半个百分点的决定，并补充说，如果通胀继续如预期般缓解，那么再降息将是合适的。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler said she “strongly supported” the central bank’s decision to lower borrowing costs by a half point last week, adding it will be appropriate to make additional rate cuts if inflation continues to ease as expected.】

item.title: OpenAI 首席技术官米拉-穆拉提（Mira Murati）表示将离开公司
item.description: OpenAI 首席技术官米拉-穆拉提（Mira Murati）周三在 X 上发表文章称，她将离开公司。【原文：OpenAI Chief Technology Officer Mira Murati said she will leave the company in a post on X on Wednesday.】

item.title: 纽约市附近发生脱轨事故，新泽西公交公司和美铁列车延误
item.description: 纽约宾夕法尼亚车站南部发生脱轨事故，导致进出该市的铁轨受阻，新泽西运输公司和美国铁路公司的列车正面临大面积延误。【原文：New Jersey Transit and Amtrak trains are facing massive delays after a derailment just south of New York Penn Station has blocked the tracks in and out of the city.】

item.title: 厄瓜多尔大火威胁富人区，总统被迫回家
item.description: 由于消防员在厄瓜多尔首都与森林大火搏斗，基多的富人区仍然受到大火的威胁，学校已转为在线教学，直至本周末。【原文：Wealthy neighborhoods in Quito remain under threat of flames and schools have shifted to online teaching through the end of the week as firefighters battle forest fires in Ecuador’s capital.】

item.title: 美联储降息为银行退出紧急贷款机制铺平道路
item.description: 硅谷银行倒闭后，向美联储紧急贷款机制借款的银行可能会加快还款速度，从而消耗金融系统的流动性。【原文：Banks that borrowed from a Federal Reserve emergency lending facility crafted after the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank might start repaying their loans at a faster pace, draining liquidity from the financial system.】

item.title: 米莱领导下的阿根廷七月经济增长超预期
item.description: 阿根廷经济在 7 月份出现了超出预期的好转，这对陷入十年来第六次衰退的哈维尔-米莱总统来说是一个充满希望的信号。【原文：Argentina’s economy posted a larger-than-expected upturn in July, a promising signal for President Javier Milei with the economy mired in its sixth recession in a decade.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚和巴拿马计划为移民开辟一条前往美国的合法丛林路线
item.description: 哥伦比亚总统古斯塔沃-彼得罗（Gustavo Petro）表示，哥伦比亚和巴拿马将寻求建立一条穿越丛林的单一、有组织的路线，成千上万的移民就是通过这条路线试图抵达美国。【原文：Colombia and Panama will seek to build a single, organized route through the jungle that hundreds of thousands of migrants cross as they attempt to reach the US, according to Colombian President Gustavo Petro.】

item.title: Cerebras Systems 目标首次公开募股筹资高达 10 亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Cerebras Systems 公司计划本周启动首次公开募股，以期在纽约上市时筹集多达 10 亿美元的资金。【原文：Cerebras Systems is planning to kick off its initial public offering this week with a view to raising as much as $1 billion in a New York listing, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 水牛城比尔队球迷在税收稀缺的纽约抢购体育场债券
item.description: 水牛城比尔队的球迷们刚刚在对阵杰克逊维尔美洲虎队的比赛中大获全胜，又取得了一场胜利；这次是在市政债券市场上。【原文：Buffalo Bills fans, fresh off a blowout win against the Jacksonville Jaguars, just scored another victory — this time in the municipal bond market.】

item.title: 美联储支持您，股票投资者
item.description: 我们有一周的时间来考虑美联储降息半个百分点的后果，我认为这将成为历史上一次激进的降息行动。股票投资者认为此举完全是利好，股票已升至历史新高。与此同时，债券则出现小幅抛售，因为他们明白软着陆的可能性增加了，这应该意味着收益率提高，债券价格下降。【原文：We’ve had a week to consider the consequences of what I think will go down as an historically aggressive move by the Federal Reserve to lower interest rates by half a percentage point. Equity investors see the move as an unalloyed positive, with stocks having risen to new all-time highs. Bonds, meanwhile, have sold off slightly, understanding that the chances of a soft landing have increased, which should mean higher yields and lower bond prices.】

item.title: Hooters 连锁餐厅聘请顾问解决收入下降带来的债务问题
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Hooters of America 正在与贷款机构和顾问进行磋商，因为收入下降迫使这家连锁餐厅关闭了几家分店。【原文：Hooters of America is huddling with lenders and advisers amid revenue declines that pushed the restaurant chain to shutter several of its locations, according to people with knowledge of the talks.】

item.title: 对冲基金因经济刺激乐观而抢购中国股票
item.description: 对冲基金纷纷买入中国股票，押注中国的新经济刺激计划能促进世界第二大经济体的增长。【原文：Hedge funds rushed to buy Chinese equities in a bet that the country’s new stimulus program can boost growth in the world’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: Meta 公司的 Orion 展示了 AR 眼镜的科幻梦想越来越近了
item.description: 从外观上看，Meta Platforms 公司的 Orion 眼镜就像一副普通的眼镜，只是有些厚重，而且还戴了有色眼镜。但是，它们并不普通。【原文：From the outside, Meta Platforms Inc.’s Orion glasses look like a normal pair of spectacles — if somewhat chunky and tinted. But they are anything but normal.】

item.title: Meta 首次推出 Orion AR 眼镜，成为智能手机的最终竞争对手
item.description: 首席执行官马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）的目标是有朝一日为人们提供智能手机的免提替代品。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. debuted its first pair of augmented reality glasses — devices that show a combined view of the digital and physical worlds, a key step in Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg’s goal of one day offering a hands-free alternative to the smartphone.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦获国际货币基金组织董事会批准 70 亿美元救助计划
item.description: 巴基斯坦从国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）获得了启动 70 亿美元贷款计划的最终批准，为该国从危机中持续复苏释放了至关重要的资金。【原文：Pakistan secured final approval to start a $7 billion loan program from the International Monetary Fund, unlocking crucial financing to sustain the nation’s recovery from a crisis.】

item.title: 微软将为三里岛清洁能源付出高昂代价
